metadata.Title: CVE-2021-2202 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Replication). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.32 andprior and 8.0.22 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows lowprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 6.5 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2202` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
